question: Question_12_(b)
statement:
Mark each statement either True or False. You do not have to justify
your answer.

If A is a 4 Ã 3 matrix, then there exists a vector $\vec{b}$ such that
$A\vec{x} = \vec{b}$ has no solutions.
sols:
\textbf{True}. After taking the row reduce of a matrix 4 Ã 3, at best,
the lowest row will be entirely consisted of zeros. If d =/= 0, then the
above has no solution. $\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 & 0 & | a \\ 
0 & 1 & 0 & | b \\ 
0 & 0 & 1 & |c \\ 
0 & 0 & 0 & |d
\end{bmatrix}$
